intro: Didymocarpus sinohenryi, commonly known as the Chinese holly. It is a deciduous shrub native to southern China, characterized by its small, glossy leaves and bright red berries. The plant belongs to the family Ericaceae and is known for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and winter berries. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, making it suitable for garden cultivation. The berries are toxic to humans and animals, so care should be taken when handling or planting this species.
